10.1080/07421222.2017.1394083.title: User Motivations in Protecting Information Security: Protection Motivation Theory Versus Self-Determination Theory
tq: How inner motivation can help in secure behavior. #sdt #motivation
Link to this article by Philip Menard, Gregory J. Bott, and Robert E. Crossler

Many IT security controls still heavily rely on human intervention. To address this concern, information security researchers look at Protection Motivation Theory (PMT) to better understand how to guide users in improved defensive skills.

10.1080/07421222.2017.1393303.title: Beyond Brainstorming: Exploring Convergence in Teams
tq: Interesting: ‘Beyond Brainstorming: Exploring Convergence in Teams’ found on #ScienceOpen

‘Beyond Brainstorming: Exploring Convergence in Teams’: an #openacccess article on #ScienceOpen. #AttentionGuidance #Brainstorming #Collaboration #DiscussionEncouragement #IdeaConvergence #IdeaQuality #IdeaSelection #Ideation #Satisfaction #Team #Teamwork
Paper Beyond #Brainstorming: Exploring #Convergence in Teams byIsabella Seeber and Ronald Maier Gert-Jan de Vreede and Barbara just published on Journal of Management Information Systems #OpenAccess
10.1080/07421222.2017.1393303.abstract: Collaborative brainstorming is often followed by a convergence activity where teams extract the most promising ideas on a useful level of detail from the brainstorming results. Contrary to the wealth of research on electronic brainstorming, there is a dearth of research on convergence. We used experimental methods for an in-depth exploration of two facilitation-based interventions in a convergence activity: attention guidance (focusing participants on procedures to execute a convergence task) and discussion encouragement (engaging participants in conversations to combine knowledge on ideas). Our findings show that both attention guidance and discussion encouragement are correlated with higher convergence quality. We argue that attention guidance's contribution is in its support of coordination, information processing, and goal specification. Similar, we argue that discussion encouragement's contribution is in its stimulation of idea clarification and idea combination. Contrary to past research, our findings further show that satisfaction was higher after convergence than after brainstorming.
